situp public API¶

class situp.Backbone[source]¶

Install Backbone

class situp.Command[source]¶

A command has a name, an option parser and a dictionary of sub commands it can call.

check_args(options, args)[source]¶

Check that the given arguments are right.

exit_invalid(msg)[source]¶

The command doesn’t exist so bail

print_help(args)[source]¶

Encapsulate the Command’s option parser’s print_help() method here in case there’s some reason to override it.

parser.print_help() actually prints to the screen, so just run that.

process_args(args=None, options=None)[source]¶

Process the option parser, updating it with data from parent parser then check the args are valid.

register_sub_commands()[source]¶

This is a dummy method for subclasses to fill in

class situp.Create[source]¶

Create a component of a CouchApp. See View(), ListGen(), Show(), Design(), App() and Document()

Set up the sub_commands and the OptionParser.

class situp.Fetch[source]¶

Copy a remote CouchApp into the working directory.

class situp.Generator[source]¶

A generator knows how to create files and where to create them.

Run the generator

class situp.InstallVendor[source]¶

register_sub_commands()[source]¶

class situp.Package¶

Package(url, filter)

filter¶

itemgetter(item, ...) –> itemgetter object

Return a callable object that fetches the given item(s) from its operand. After, f=itemgetter(2), the call f(r) returns r[2]. After, g=itemgetter(2,5,3), the call g(r) returns (r[2], r[5], r[3])

url¶

itemgetter(item, ...) –> itemgetter object

Return a callable object that fetches the given item(s) from its operand. After, f=itemgetter(2), the call f(r) returns r[2]. After, g=itemgetter(2,5,3), the call g(r) returns (r[2], r[5], r[3])

class situp.Push[source]¶

The Push command sends the application to the CouchDB server.
